title: 107_hr5326
content: The Act may be cited as the "National AMBER Alert Network Act of 2002" and it establishes national coordination of the AMBER Alert communications network. The Attorney General appoints an officer as the national coordinator of the AMBER Alert network for abducted children. The Coordinator's duties include closing network gaps, promoting local AMBER plans, ensuring regional coordination, and serving as the national contact point for network development. The national coordinator of the AMBER Alert network is responsible for developing the network and coordinating alerts on abducted children regionally. They must consult with the FBI on child abductions and cooperate with the Department of Transportation and the FCC. Minimum standards for issuing and sharing alerts through the AMBER Alert communications network are outlined in Section 3. The AMBER Alert Coordinator of the Department of Justice will establish voluntary minimum standards for issuing and disseminating alerts through the AMBER Alert communications network. The dissemination of alerts will be limited to geographic areas most likely to aid in the recovery of the abducted child. The Coordinator must not interfere with the current voluntary system. The Coordinator will cooperate with relevant authorities and organizations to establish minimum standards for the AMBER Alert communications network. Grant program established for notification and communications systems along highways to aid in the recovery of abducted children. The Secretary of Transportation will provide grants to States for notification systems along highways to aid in recovering abducted children. Activities may include electronic message boards and other means of disseminating alerts. Federal funding may cover up to 50% of the costs. The Secretary of Transportation will distribute grants equitably across the US for notification systems to aid in recovering abducted children. The Secretary will set requirements for grant applications, and $20,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 2003 for this program. SEC. 5. GRANT PROGRAM FOR SUPPORT OF AMBER ALERT COMMUNICATIONS PLANS. The Attorney General will provide grants to States for AMBER Alert communications plans, including education, training, law enforcement programs, and equipment. The Federal share of funding for these activities cannot exceed 50 percent. The Attorney General will distribute grants under the program on an equitable basis throughout the US regions. Requirements for grants, including application requirements, will be prescribed. $5,000,000 is authorized for the Department of Justice for fiscal year 2003, with amounts remaining available until expended.
